lead_paragraph: Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman of New York said Mr. Rosen failed to pay taxes on $80 million in artwork that he had bought or commissioned since 2002.

headline.print_headline: Developer to Pay State $7 Million for Sales Taxes on Art
headline.main: Developer Aby Rosen to Pay $7 Million in Suit Over Unpaid Taxes on Art

snippet: Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman of New York said Mr. Rosen failed to pay taxes on $80 million in artwork that he had bought or commissioned since 2002.
abstract: New York Atty Gen Eric T Schneidermann says Manhattan real estate developer and art collector Aby J Rosen will pay $7 million settlement for failure to pay state sales taxes on $80 million in artwork he bought or commissioned since 2002; decision draws distinction between dealers who buy works for resale, and who do not need to pay taxes, and collectors who treat works as their own even if they plan to sell them later on.
